feed.title: Category: USF | Dave's not here man

entry.title: first two weeks
entry.content:
so I’ve been back to school for two weeks now, some thoughts-

  • The university is huge compared to HCC!

  • I feel really old sitting in a first-year physics lecture.

  • I’ve been programming a lot less since school started :(

The last point worries me but I have to get through this year of engineering pre-reqs before I’m accepted into the Computer Science department. I hope it doesn’t set me back.

entry.title: school and stuff
entry.content:
school

In two weeks I start studying at USF. I’m pretty excited to make the transition from community college to a university. I have two calculus classes and two physics classes to do before I’m accepted into the Computer Science program but I’m (semi)confident I’ll get it done and get in.

stuff

Besides the new school year there have been other developments, some I can’t talk about quite yet and some I can. I got into a wreck a few weeks back when I zoned out and jumped the median into oncoming traffic. Luckily I came to as the car started spinning around and miraculously ended up on the other side of the road unharmed. The car was out of commission for a few weeks while I got to experience the local bus system…

There were a few belligerent (and amusing) drunks and some long walks after missing connections but it wasn’t too bad overall. Honestly for a while after that scare I didn’t want to drive.

I’m also working on my programming, the two things I’m currently occupied with are,

  • exercism.io: A ‘coding exercise’ website with an awesome code –> peer review –> refactor model

  • Coursera’s Algorithms course: I tried this course about a year ago but had a hard time, now I think I’m ready for it.

Well, I guess that’s all I got for now, auf wiedersehen!
